title: About
text:
Hi, my name is Luke Li and I am a rising senior at Lexington High School (Year of Graduation 2026).
Github: https://github.com/lukearoni
Email: lukelex2008@gmail.com
This project is about establishment entry rates of different metropolitan areas in the US. Here is the link to the github repository: https://github.com/lukearoni/business-success
This project was created as a part of Kane’s Data Science Bootcamp.

title: New Businesses
text: Description: Establishment entry rates vary amongst different metropolitan areas. We obtained a dataset containing business dynamics data from the US Census Bureau, including the 2022 establishment entry and exit rates for each metropolitan area. This records the number of new shops, startups, or franchise buildings divided by the total number of establishments in that area during 2022. We seek to use this data to find the metropolitan areas with the highest rate. Sheridan, Wyoming is a high outlier for establishment entry rates, with an over 6% increase from the second highest, while the rest of the top 20 metropolitan area entry rates don’t differ by more than 2.2%.

Model 1 (for plot 1) \[
\text{net\_job\_creation\_rate}_i = \beta_0 + \beta_1 \cdot \text{estabs\_entry\_rate}_i + \epsilon_i
\]
Model 2 (for plot 2) \[
\text{job\_creation\_rate\_births}_i = \beta_0 + \beta_1 \cdot \text{estabs\_entry\_rate}_i + \epsilon_i
\]

title: Sources
text:
US Census Bureau 2022 Business Dynamics Statistics Dataset (MSA) US Census Bureau Metropolitan Area Code and Area Name (Mar. 2020)
We obtained the data by using the US Census Bureau Datasets. From those datasets, we converted them to csv files and added them to the project. We did not have to wrangle the data much, only changing column names for ease of use as well as eliminating duplicate data. We also dropped data that had any not available information.
